content: The "Federal Oil and Gas Reform Act of 1999" is cited as the short title. Section 109 of the Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 is amended to include civil penalties for violations related to federal oil and gas royalties. Section 109 of the Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 is amended to include civil penalties for violations related to federal oil and gas royalties. It prohibits failing to comply with royalty payment requirements, making false reports, and imposes penalties for violations. The Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 includes civil penalties for violations related to federal oil and gas royalties. Violations include failure to pay royalties, false reporting, and lease administration violations such as failure to notify the Secretary or permit lawful entry and inspection. Penalties include treble the royalty amount plus interest, a $25,000 civil penalty per violation per day, and exemptions if violations are reported and corrected within 30 days. The Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 imposes civil penalties for violations related to federal oil and gas royalties. Penalties include up to $10,000 per day for failure to comply with lease management responsibilities and up to $25,000 per day for theft of oil or gas without legal authority. The Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 imposes civil penalties for violations related to federal oil and gas royalties. Penalties include fines for repeated violations, demanding compliance within 30 days, and potential shut down of oil or gas leases for persistent violations. The Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 allows the Secretary to impose penalties on individuals for violations related to federal oil and gas leases. Penalties may include restrictions on acquiring additional leases, canceling or transferring existing leases, and collecting reimbursement for costs related to lease release or transfer. Administrative appeals can be filed within 15 days of notification of penalties, with final determinations made by the Secretary or designee. The Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 allows the Secretary to impose penalties on individuals for violations related to federal oil and gas leases. Penalties may include restrictions on acquiring additional leases, canceling or transferring existing leases, and collecting reimbursement for costs related to lease release or transfer. Administrative appeals can be filed within 15 days of notification of penalties, with final determinations made by the Secretary or designee. The amount of any penalty may be deducted from sums owed by the United States, and the Secretary has the authority to compromise or reduce civil penalties on a case-by-case basis. Notice of penalties shall be served personally or by registered mail, and individuals have the right to designate a representative to receive such notices. The Secretary must provide reasons for penalty determinations and any decisions on remittance or reduction, and individuals aggrieved by final orders may seek judicial review in the United States district court. The United States district court has jurisdiction to review civil penalty assessments under the Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act. Failure to pay penalties can result in court-ordered payment plus interest. No civil penalty is imposed for failure to pay rent on a lease automatically terminated under the Mineral Leasing Act. The Mineral Leasing Act allows the tolling of statutes of limitation for violations related to oil and gas leases until corrected or a final order is issued. Violators must maintain records until released by the Secretary or expiration of the required period. The Mineral Leasing Act allows tolling of statutes of limitation for violations related to oil and gas leases until corrected or final order issued. Amounts received in actions under section 3730 of title 31, arising from underpayment of royalties, are treated as royalties paid for mineral leasing laws and Land and Water Conservation Fund Act. SEC. 3. SHARED CIVIL PENALTIES. Amendment to the Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 to increase civil penalties for underpayment of royalties.
